poem:
**Diplomatic Entanglements**

In the quiet corners  
of political discourse,  
a promise is whispered:  
oil's shadow lengthens.  
India, a river  
flowing East, West—  
doubts cast like stones  
across water's surface,  
rings of intention  
fading. Underneath,  
the earth holds its secrets  
close, unmoved  
by words of assurance.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. On Wednesday, Trump claimed that Modi had assured him “today” that India would put an end to its purchase of Russian oil. “I was not happy that India was buying oil, and he [Modi] has assured me today". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
